content.description:
Climb up and right on the slab below the wall, starting just right of the anchors atop the original first pitch of

Sucking Wind

. If you're belaying from the anchors on the Railroad Tracks Cracks, you'll want to back clean any gear you place on the slab or use really, really long slings.

After climbing the slab, you'll find yourself underneath the finger-sized splitter of Victory Bowl. Hard, committing moves directly above the slab lead to more splitter finger crack and a roof at the top before the ledge with a two bolt anchor shared with

Peapod

.
content.protection: Gear to 2 inches with extras in the finger sizes.
content.location: Climbs the finger-sized splitter on the face of the Upper Tier, the wall directly above the Railroad Tracks Cracks.

content.description:
Climb up and right on the slab below the wall, starting just right of the anchors atop the original first pitch of

Sucking Wind

. If you're belaying from the anchors on the Railroad Tracks Cracks, you'll want to back clean any gear you place on the slab or use really, really long slings.

After climbing the slab, you'll find yourself underneath the finger-sized splitter of

Victory Bowl

. Move right, placing a good hand-sized piece before pulling around a flake and into the right-facing corner. Pulling the first roof in the corner is probably the crux and is an awkward, difficult move, protected in part by a fixed stopper. Above, continue with thin climbing in the corner to another roof, this one more easily navigated. Easier climbing above leads to a step left to the ledge with a two bolt anchor shared with

Victory Bowl

.
content.protection: Gear to 2 inches with some extra finger-sized pieces and long runners.
content.location: The righthand of the two cracks on the Upper Tier, the wall directly above the Railroad Tracks Cracks. Climbs the right-facing corner.
